Sentencas: An inert-supported cell (ISC) was developed by Bosch with the aim of lowering the manufacturing costs of SOFCs and thus increasing their marketability and prolonging their lifetime.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: This ISC concept uses forsterite, a magnesium silicate doped with Zn and Ca, as support material.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: The cell can be described as air side inert-supported cell, since forsterite faces the air compartment.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: Forsterite was chosen as a support material, as it is abundant and therefore relatively inexpensive.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: All functional layers are subsequently applied and co-sintered at T < 1300 degrees C to further reduce cell manufacturing costs.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: At present, LSM is used as a cathode.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: However, the performance of the cell is drastically reduced due to the formation of a Zn-Mn spinel at the triple-phase boundaries during co-firing.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: Based on these findings, seven different cathodes were synthesized to identify a cathode that is less reactive with forsterite.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: In order to investigate their reactivity, different types of samples were prepared: mixed pellets, double-layered pellets and screen-printed cathode inks on forsterite green substrates.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: These samples and their cross sections were then investigated by using XRD, SEM, EDX, and WDX.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions

Sentencas: Their reactivity was as follows (ascending order): LSFM > LSF > LSC > PSCF > LSCF > LCCF.
Titulo: Selection of cathode materials for forsterite supported solid oxide fuel cells - Part I: Materials interactions
